field.value:
When I try to specify "NHibernate.Cfg.ImprovedNamingStrategy, NHibernate" for my namingstrategytype, I get an error saying that the class does not have a public zero-argument constructor. Which it doesn't because it implements the singleton pattern and has a private zero-argument constructor. So I ended up reimplementing ImprovedNamingStrategy but with a public zero-argument constructor. A bit clumsy for sure. I see no reason ImprovedNamingStrategy would need to implement the singleton pattern. I'd like to submit a patch, but I'm not sure if I should submit one to this project so it can use classes that cannot be instantiated in the typical fashion or if you recommend I submit one to NHibernate.
Advice?

comment.author: jonorossi
comment.text: ActiveRecord is not actively maintained, closing this issue as won't fix because of its age. Feel free to relog a new issue on GitHub: https://github.com/castleproject/ActiveRecord/issues
